content.description: Getting off of the ground and then moving above the first ledge are the trickiest parts. The rest is no problem.
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Just to the right of the middle of Bulge Wall and left of the only major vertical seam on Bulge Wall.

content.description: A short route with closely-spaced bolts that involves interesting moves on solid rock.
content.protection: 4 bolts to two bolt anchor with chains
content.location: On the far left side of Bulge Wall, in front of a large tree and directly below the left leaning tree on a ledge above. The anchors can't be see from the ground, but they're just left and below the leaning tree.

content.description:
The best part about this route is the cool undercling move which reminds me of how Trump greets a foxy lady. 

  I made this route name up, instead of just calling it unknown. If you know the real name, let me know and I'll update it.
content.protection: 4 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Just to the left of the body-width crack on the far right side of Bulge Wall.

content.description: Getting up the slab at the bottom requires using tiny edges followed by a traverse to the right using underclings in the large horizontal gap. Next comes a tricky move to gain the upper face. The run-out to the anchors of Hammered, to the left is no problem, but don't fall.
content.protection: 4 bolts to shared two bolt anchor with chains on Hammered
content.location: Towards the left side of Bulge Wall. Look for a 4 bolt route where the bolt pattern goes all over the place.

content.description: Easier than it looks at the bottom, but harder than it looks above the horizontal gap. Above the gap, the climbing becomes overhanging, committing and tricky.
content.protection: 3 bolts with 2 bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Look for the circuitous routes with widely spaced bolts on the left side of Bulge Wall. Hammered is the left of the two that share an two bolt anchor.

content.description: Follow a left angled ramp up to the right end of the large horizontal gap that splits Bulge Wall, from there follow the vertical crack to the top.
content.protection: Gear, can be cleaned from The X, or wrap from a tree above.
content.location: Between The X on the left and Trump Style Greeting on the right. The only major vertical crack that runs from the large horizontal gap to the top of the wall.

content.description: The climbing at Bulge Wall is challenging, but far less powerful than Damage Wall or Power Wall climbing, with most of the climbs being less than vertical and having a good rest halfway up. The holds are mostly straightforward crimps, but require some thinking to navigate through. Trump Style Greeting, towards the right side of the wall has a cool undercling move about one third of the way up. The climbs towards the left side of the wall begin with tiny holds on low angle rock, involve overcoming the horizontal gap with balancy moves, and finish with slightly overhanging crimping.
